text:
Hi all, Martin here :slightly_smiling_face:!
During college I competed in algorithms, did internships in Google & Palantir and did my Master's thesis (MCS) in the field of bioinformatics (on the algorithmic side). After that I did a startup and worked on different projects, latest worked as a lead engineer for London-based bioinformatics startup (developing a web app/platform).
I am excited about open source, computer science, functional programming, emacs, startups.
Right now I am working with my twin brother on a programming language of our own that is specialized for developing web apps (I will write more about the language in the <#CCL5VVBAN|share-your-work> channel).
I found out about this community through google search, and I am really excited that I will be able to learn from (and hopefully also help) so many experienced people working on similar problems!

text: Hello. I'm a full stack developer working mostly with JavaScript. Maybe thanks to unix, npm, and functional programming, I'm obsessed with pushing the bar toward simple, modular, expressive, reusable code, but not necessarily any good at it. My primary goal in programming right now is to write or settle on a JavaScript FRP library. To that end, I came across a Future of Coding blog post that talked about Reflex and Hareactive, and that lead me here.

text: Hi everyone! :slightly_smiling_face: I work on developer tooling in my day job and poke slowly at better ways to program in my vanishingly small spare time. I've been interested in FoC-adjacent topics for a long time and eventually found my way here by way of following <@UCUSW7WVD>’s Mu progress on Mastodon.
